TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is a former partner in a limited partnership company , which was wound - up in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the company 's estate reported an offence against the applicant . The applicant was first interrogated by the police on DATE on suspicion of , inter alia , offences of debtor 's fraud , dishonesty and bookkeeping . In DATE he was charged on CARDINAL counts .

CARDINAL . The GPE ORG ( käräjäoikeus , tingsrätten ) held the first hearing on DATE . In the following CARDINAL hearings it heard CARDINAL witnesses named by the prosecutor and CARDINAL witnesses named by the applicant .

CARDINAL . At the CARDINALth hearing on DATE ORG delivered its judgment . It convicted the applicant of , inter alia , CARDINAL aggravated debtor 's frauds , CARDINAL offences of debtor 's dishonesty and CARDINAL bookkeeping offences and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment . He was ordered to pay the company 's estate CARDINAL NORP Marks ( ORG ; corresponding to MONEY ( EUR ) ) in compensation and to reimburse its legal expenses .

CARDINAL . He appealed to ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ) , requesting an oral hearing . On DATE he asked the court to speed up the proceedings and to dismiss the charges because of the length of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE , without having held an oral hearing , ORG upheld ORG judgment with some minor amendments . His conviction was reduced to DATE imprisonment . It rejected the applicant 's further claims with the reasoning that the proceedings had not exceeded a reasonable time .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused the applicant leave to appeal .
